div.p:
Online user 1:
What about older people, I'm gonna add older people to my list. I mean, when you're young, you can drink a lot more, but when you're old, there's no way.

Online user 2:
Older people?! No, I think everybody would say criminals, cause, they're in jail for a reason.

Online user 3:
Yeah, I would definitely agree with that. What about celebrities though? I mean, they've got all that money, people throwing them drinks all the time, you're bound to get alcoholism that way.

Antonio:
So what you think about the list of words? Does it surprise you?

Michelle:
Not at all. It makes sense most people to believe this is the kind of person who develops alcoholism or drug addiction.

Antonio:
Because of stereotypes they’ve seen or heard?

Michelle:
Yeah, and because of they’ve own experiences. For example, say I have a friend, and her mom and grandfather both have alcoholism, and then starts to have problems with her own drinking. It feels like, to me, she's just living out a family tradition. Or, here's another one. Say a person says they'll only have one or two drinks, but then they end up closing down the bar. Or once they open a bottle, they finish it. It feels like they're weak, or have no self control.

Antonio:
Okay, so it makes sense that people would have these beliefs, but why does it matter?

Michelle:
Well, it matters for a couple reasons and it really revolves around our choices. First off, how many of us would look at that list and say, "yeah, that's me."

Internet dater:
Ugh, look at this guy. Weak, depressed loser with no self-esteem. Is he for real??

Antonio:
Yeah, there aren’t many people who’d say they are a weak, depressed, loser with low-self esteem.

Michelle:
Right, so if I don't see myself on the list, I may feel like I don't need to worry. My choices don't matter.

Antonio:
Since so many people believe this list is true, there must be some accuracy to it, right?

Michelle:
Right, to check out if it's accurate or not, we need to look at one more question: “Is alcoholism and drug addiction caused by the kind of person I am or by the kind of choices I make?"
